channel.title: Lug on Notre Dame Linux Users Group
channel.description: Recent content in Lug on Notre Dame Linux Users Group

item.title: Internship Panel 2020
item.description: President Michael Eisemann is joined by Professor Peter Bui and Zephan Enciso to briefly discuss some FOSS news. Later, Gavin Inglis, Emory Smith, and Sam Battalio field questions about their recent internship experiences and offer advice to underclassmen on how to get their desired job.

item.title: Wowzers! We're Starting a Podcast!
item.description: President Michael Eisemann is joined by Professor Peter Bui and System Administrator Zephan Enciso to kick off this year’s LUG with a FOSS news podcast.

item.title: NDLUG IRC Server!
item.description: New IRC Server, who dis?

item.title: 2020 LUG Officers!
item.description: Your new Supreme Leaders have been chosen!

item.title: 2020 LUG Elections
item.description: LUG Elections are coming up! Go vote!

item.title: Practical Applications of Tmux + Remote Computing
item.description: Lug members learn about Remote Computing in a variety of applied concepts.

item.title: Text Editors in the Field
item.description: LUG members share and learn about text editors.

item.title: Raspberry Pi Showcase
item.description: LUG members show off some Raspberry Pi projects.

item.title: Flask Tutorial/Hackathon Prep
item.description: Professor Bui and Noah speak about Web Dev and Python’s Flask

item.title: Zephan M. Enciso
item.description: Hey, I’m Zephan Enciso, a junior studying Computer Engineering and Electrical Engineering. I typically run Arch Linux with KDE and/or i3-gaps. Most LUGites know me as a huge computer hardware nerd, but outside of LUG, I enjoy olympic archery, playing violin, taking pictures, or pwning noobs in video games.

item.title: Bryan Ingwersen (bingwers)
item.description: I am a first year student at Notre Dame who just joined LUG. More information to come!

item.title: Parker Chun (pchun)
item.description:
My name is Parker Chun. I am a current sophomore studying computer science at the University of Notre Dame.
Apart from my computer science related coursework, extracurriculars, and interests, I like to dance, play the piano, and play basketball.

item.title: Bradley Budden (bbudden)
item.description: My name is Brad Budden. I am a current sophomore studying computer science at the University of Notre Dame. I’m not sure exactly what field of computer science I will be most interested in, but I enjoy learning about linux and have fun with embedded systems programming for arduinos. Last summer, I studied abroad in Rome, taking classes in quantum engineering and visual programming. I and was able to travel all over Italy and to Greece, Switzerland, and Sweden Next spring I hope to participate in the Notre Dame Silicon Valley Semester, a program offered by ND out in the valley for students looking to take relevant courses and work at local companies/startups.

item.title: Eamon Lopez Marmion (elopez7)
item.description: My name is Eamon. I am a (non dues-paying) member of NDLUG.

item.title: Kathryn Hund (khund)
item.description: My name’s Kathryn Hund, and I’m currently a freshman at Saint Mary’s. I’m from Florida (on the east coast - right in the destruction path of every hurricane). My intended major is Computing & Applied Mathematics. I’m looking forward to participating in NDLUG to get more familiar with both Linux in particular and open source in general. My current goals are to become an active contributor to open source, and to participate in Google Summer of Code at least once.

item.title: Noah Yoshida (nyoshida)
item.description: Hello! I am Noah. I order pizza for Lug.

item.title: Mike 'AndroidKitKat' Eisemann
item.description: Hiya, I’m Mike Eisemann, but most of you probably know me as AndroidKitKat. I’m the current Vice President of NDLUG. I am a computer science major and thinking about minoring in Japanese. Some of my favorite things are VR video games and learning Japanese. If you want to read more about me, check out my personal website at https://www.michaeleisemann.com/

item.title: Dalton Dove (ddove)
item.description: Hello I am Dalton Dove and I am a sophomore in computer engineering.

item.title: Gavin Inglis (ginglis)
item.description:
My name is Gavin Inglis. I am a current junior studying computer science at the University of Notre Dame. My main interests are Systems Programming and Linux, but I enjoy reading and learning about all things computer science.
I am a SysAdmin and Secretary for the Notre Dame Linux Users Group. I most recently worked for Accenture on a project in the Public Health space in Cincinnati. I was introduced to Salesforce tools, and I had experience developing and administrating in Salesforce.

item.title: Jacob Mazur (jmazur2)
item.description:
My name is Jacob Mazur. I am a sophomore studying computer engineering at the University of Notre Dame.
I am interested in most things related to technology, particularly computer hardware.
*That's me all the way on the left, pictured with Logan, Noah, and AKK* --

item.title: Joe Kuebler (jkuebler)
item.description: My name is Joe Kuebler. I am a current sophomore studying computer science at the University of Notre Dame. Some things i enjoy outisde of cimputer science are soccer, politics, and traveling.

item.title: Keegan MacDonell (kmacdon7)
item.description: My name is Keegan MacDonell. I am a current sophomore studying computer science at the University of Notre Dame.

item.title: Nick Locascio (nlocasci)
item.description: My name is Nick Locascio. I am a sophomore computer science major here at Notre Dame and I am originally from Denver, Colorado.

item.title: Nolan McShea (nmcshea)
item.description: Hi! My name is Nolan McShea and I’m a sophomore majoring in Computer Science! I recently just dropped my digital marketing minor so I can’t say that I’m minoring in digital marketing anymore, which stinks but it was boring so I don’t care. My college-long objective is to make a video game! (I wanna finish it by the time I graduate) So right now I’m trying to learn digital music.

item.title: Intro to the Command Line
item.description: Logan talks about the command line, and officers guide a command line adventure.

item.title: Intro to Linux
item.description: Senior officer Noah Yoshida helps some Linux newcomers set up and get comfortable with the operating system.

item.title: 2019 Installfest
item.description: Success stories from this weekend’s Installfest, brought to you by LUG.

item.title: LUG at the 2019 Activities Fair
item.description: A recap of a successful outing at the 2019 activities fair.

item.title: 2019-2020 Elections
item.description: The Elections for the 2019-2020 School year.

item.title: HacktoberFest and Contributing to Open Source
item.description: In the midst of HacktoberFest, President Tim Burchfield (8bit) talks about contibuting to Open Source.

item.title: 2018-2019 Elections
item.description: We decided to force people to record videos to run for the officer chairs. Here were the results:
